title: REPORT: Trump May Designate Muslim Brotherhood as a Terrorist Organization
text:
California City Passes Unanimous Resolution to Impeach Trump 
It’s a different story with the Muslim Brotherhood . 
The Islamist group has ingrained itself deeply into the daily life and political structure of numerous Middle Eastern and North African nations, and talk of designating it as an official terrorist organization has some of America’s putative allies in the region expressing concern, according to The New York Times . 
While the Brotherhood has indeed publicly renounced violence and gained legitimate power to an extent through democratic means in some nations –such as Jordan, Morocco and Tunisia — some of its affiliates and offshoots in other nations — such as Hamas in Gaza, or the deposed Brotherhood in Egypt — have no qualms about utilizing terror and violence in order to obtain or secure power and authority, as was seen in the region-wide misnamed “Arab Spring” the Brotherhood helped foment.   
A lengthy but informative piece from Breitbart laid out the true nature of the Muslim Brotherhood, revealing that beyond the flowery talk of nonviolence, peaceful coexistence and “shared values” intended for naive and uninformed ears, the overarching goal of the group is to eventually establish a worldwide Islamic caliphate based upon and governed by Shariah law. 
We have explained here previously how Shariah law is largely incompatible with our Constitution and Western way of life, as it openly treats women, children and non-Muslims as second-class citizens, denying them the equal rights and protections that are so cherished in America and other Western nations, among other reasons. 
Should the Trump administration proceed with designating the Muslim Brotherhood as an official foreign terrorist organization bent on subverting the United States, it would not be alone, as the Brotherhood has already been outlawed by such Muslim nations as Egypt, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. 
However, given the inherent temporary nature of executive orders — which can simply be overturned or countermanded by a future president — it may be wise of the Trump administration to seek out and support congressional efforts to achieve the same result via legislation, declaring the Muslim Brotherhood and its affiliated offshoots to be foreign terrorist organizations by a bill signed into law.
